page.title: 11LYLE AND SCOTT
page.content: Lyle and Scott's factory in Jedburgh was opened in 1956.It is a two-storey building in Bongate,next to Garage premises.They make Intarsia fronts for jerseys and jumpers mainly using cashmere wool.This is done by hand on machines by men.The backs and sleeves come from Hawick,and at Jedburgh the women do the collar-linking,binding and hand-sewing.The finished products goback to Hawick for washing and dispatch to Japan,U.S.A.,W.Germany and elsewhere. The designing of the jerseys is done in Hawick,and they cost Â£100 to make, but in the shops they will cost nearly Â£200. There are other factories in Hawick and Kelso employing about 600 altogether,with around 60 employed in Jedburgh.
